page.title: 10THE DEVIL IN DANBURY
page.content: One of the first legends that was told in Danbury was when a terrible storm destroyed the timber spire on the 24th of May 1402.The storm occurred during Evensong and the devil appeared in the church at that time. THE DEVIL AND THE BELL One dark night a devil roamed Danbury when he found the chantry.The devil knocked on the door and a monk opened it.The devil said, "Can I come in?"The monk refused.The devil walked to the church.He peered up and saw the bell tower and the six bells.He climbed the bell tower and seized a bell and took it outside.He placed the jewels that he had stolen in the bell.Then he walked down the hill.Gradually the bell became too heavy so it was left on the site of The Bell pub.This could explain the pub's name and also why the church has five bells and not six.
